intro: Zephyranthes cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in response to rain. The plant typically grows from a bulb and produces showy white or pale pink petals. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Zephyranthes cubensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions.
